glsa.title: Xmail: Privilege escalation through sendmail
glsa.synopsis: The sendmail program in Xmail is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, potentially resulting in local privilege escalation.

background.p: Xmail is an Internet and intranet mail server.

description.p: iDEFENSE reported that the AddressFromAtPtr function in the sendmail program fails to check bounds on arguments passed from other functions, and as a result an exploitable stack overflow condition occurs when specifying the "-t" command line option.

impact.p: A local attacker can make a malicious call to sendmail, potentially resulting in code execution with elevated privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Xmail users should upgrade to the latest version:
